tournament.name: Thursday 1st Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to play powerful spells for free, while controlling the opponent's board with removal spells and disruptive cards like Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Sphinx of Foresight and Narset of the Ancient Way to maintain a strong hand presence. The overall strategy is to outvalue the opponent and establish control of the game, while using Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion for additional card draw and synergy with the high mana cost cards in the deck.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast powerful spells for free. It includes cards like Shark Typhoon, Narset of the Ancient Way, and Teferi, Time Raveler to generate card advantage and control the board. Fae of Wishes allows for flexibility in grabbing key sideboard cards. The deck also includes board wipes like Shatter the Sky and Deafening Clarion to clear the opponent's creatures. The goal is to out-value the opponent and establish control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the game with board wipes like Deafening Clarion and Shatter the Sky. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi to generate card advantage and disrupt opponents. Fae of Wishes enables access to a sideboard of versatile answers and threats. Kenrith provides a versatile finisher, while Shark Typhoon can create a steady stream of threats. Overall, the deck aims to dominate the board and out-value opponents with its powerful spells and planeswalkers.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free while also controlling the opponent's actions with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and ramp up with cards like Sphinx of Foresight and Cavalier of Flame. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion provides additional card draw and fits well within the control archetype of the deck. The mana base is also carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies with cards like Cauldron Familiar, Woe Strider, and Mayhem Devil to control the board and generate value. Korvold, Fae-Cursed King acts as a powerful threat and card draw engine, while cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Midnight Reaper provide additional ways to generate value through sacrificing creatures. The deck also utilizes the food token generation from Gilded Goose and Witch's Oven to fuel its engine. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents through efficient sacrifice interactions and strong threats like Korvold.

The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers and removal spells to control the game while generating card advantage and value. It includes powerful cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to generate advantage. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death to control the board. With a high land count and ramp spells like Growth Spiral, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and overwhelm them with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, as well as board wipes like Shatter the Sky to maintain board presence. It also utilizes ramp spells like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to accelerate its mana production and play big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Agent of Treachery. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents for extra ETB effects.

This deck focuses on a control strategy, using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's plans. It also includes removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Time Wipe to deal with threats. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with cards like Omen of the Sea and Elite Guardmage. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value by blinking permanents. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent in a slower, more grindy game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention card to cast powerful spells for free. It includes a mix of removal spells like Deafening Clarion and counterspells like Mystical Dispute to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes strong creatures like Cavalier of Flame, Sphinx of Foresight, Bonecrusher Giant, and Kenrith, the Returned King to apply pressure and close out the game. The companion Keruga, the Macrosage provides card advantage and ensures the deck has a consistent stream of threats and answers.

The deck aims to control the board by using Teferi, Time Raveler and Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. It generates card advantage and board presence with cards like Omen of the Sea and Cavalier of Flame, while also providing flexibility with Fae of Wishes for additional win conditions. The deck utilizes a variety of colors and mana fixing lands to ensure consistency in casting spells and maintaining a dominant position on the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless onslaught of powerful creatures. By playing strong creatures like Stonecoil Serpent, Questing Beast, and Yorvo, Lord of Garenbrig early in the game, the deck aims to quickly build up a formidable board presence. Cards like Gemrazer and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger provide removal options and additional support, while Vivien, Monsters' Advocate can generate card advantage and help refill the board. With a solid mana base and aggressive creatures, this mono green aggro deck aims to pressure the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing small creatures and sacrificing them for value, triggering various abilities. It aims to deal consistent damage through sacrificing creatures, draining opponents' life points, and generating incremental advantage. The key strategy involves creating a loop with Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, and sacrificing creatures to trigger effects like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Cruel Celebrant. The deck utilizes cards like Mire's Grasp and Dead Weight for removal and Knight of the Ebon Legion for additional aggression. Castle Locthwain provides card advantage while ensuring the deck maintains a steady flow of threats.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on dealing consistent damage to the opponent through a combination of sacrificing creatures for value and utilizing direct damage effects. By leveraging the synergy between cards like Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, Mayhem Devil, and Claim the Firstborn, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while generating incremental advantages. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides the deck with additional resilience and recursion options, allowing for sustained aggression throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects and recursion to generate value and overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures. It uses cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Priest of Forgotten Gods to constantly sacrifice and bring back creatures, while also using Claim the Firstborn to steal opponents' creatures. Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Dreadhorde Butcher provide additional pressure and disruption, with Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents in a fast-paced aggro strategy.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through counterspells and removal spells like Mystical Dispute and Scorching Dragonfire. It seeks to establish a strong mana base with cards like Fabled Passage and Wilderness Reclamation to enable powerful plays with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. The deck also has card advantage through spells like Opt and Growth Spiral, while also having a win condition in Expansion / Explosion. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent while setting up for a game-winning play.
